chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall P : Z -> Prop, (forall x : Z, (forall y : Z, R_prime y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : Z, P x

Premises:
R_prime = fun x y : Z => 1 < x /\ 1 < y /\ x < y : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments R_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.pos p)) -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.neg p)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P 0 -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.pos p)) -> (forall p : positive, P (Z.neg p)) -> forall z : Z, P z
fast_Zplus_comm : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (y + x) -> P (x + y)
Decidable.dec_not_not : forall P : Prop, Decidable.decidable P -> (~ P -> False) -> P
fast_Zred_factor0 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * 1) -> P x
fast_Zopp_eq_mult_neg_1 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * -1) -> P (- x)
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
fast_OMEGA13 : forall (v l1 l2 : Z) (x : positive) (P : Z -> Prop), P (l1 + l2) -> P (v * Z.pos x + l1 + (v * Z.neg x + l2))
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Z.max_min_antimono : forall f : Z -> Z, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) f -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful Z.le (Basics.flip Z.le)) f -> forall x y : Z, Z.max (f x) (f y) = f (Z.min x y)
well_founded_lt_compat : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (R : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> (f x < f y)%nat) -> well_founded R
R_prime_wf = (fun R_prime_wf_subproof : forall x : Z, 1 < x -> 0 <= x => well_founded_lt_compat Z f_Z R_prime (fun (x y : Z) (H : 1 < x /\ 1 < y /\ x < y) => Zabs_nat_lt x y (and_ind (fun (H0 : 1 < x) (H1 : 1 < y /\ x < y) => and_ind (fun (_ : 1 < y) (H3 : x < y) => conj (R_prime_wf_subproof x H0) H3) H1) H))) (fun (x : Z) (H0 : 1 < x) => Decidable.dec_not_not (0 <= x) (Z.le_decidable 0 x) (fun H1 : ~ 0 <= x => (fun H2 : 0 > x => fast_Zplus_assoc_reverse x (-1) (-1) (fun x0 : Z => 0 <= x0 -> False) (fast_Zred...
fast_Zplus_assoc_reverse : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (n + (m + p)) -> P (n + m + p)
IDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp reqb (IDphi (R:=R))
Z.compare_eq : forall x y : Z, (x ?= y) = Eq -> x = y
OMEGA2 : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x + y
Z.rem_0_r_ext : forall x y : Z, y = 0 -> Z.rem x y = x
proj1_sig : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), {x : A | P x} -> A
ConstructiveCauchyRealsMult.CRealPosShift : forall x : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal, ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt (ConstructiveCauchyReals.inject_Q {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |}) x -> {y : positive * ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal | ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealEq x (snd y) /\ (forall n : nat, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 1; QArith_base.Qden := fst y |} (proj1_sig (snd y) n))}
ConstructiveCauchyRealsMult.CRealNegShift : forall x : ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal, ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealLt x (ConstructiveCauchyReals.inject_Q {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |}) -> {y : positive * ConstructiveCauchyReals.CReal | ConstructiveCauchyReals.CRealEq x (snd y) /\ (forall n : nat, QArith_base.Qlt (proj1_sig (snd y) n) {| QArith_base.Qnum := -1; QArith_base.Qden := fst y |})}
QArith_base.Qlt = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qnum x * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden y) < QArith_base.Qnum y * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden x) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qlt (_ _)%Q_scope
Z.strong_left_induction : forall A : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : Z, (forall n : Z, n <= z -> (forall m : Z, m <= z -> Z.succ n <= m -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : Z, n <= z -> A n
QArith_base.Qeq_bool_eq : forall x y : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq_bool x y = true -> QArith_base.Qeq x y
Z.ls_ls' : forall A : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : Z, A z -> (forall n : Z, n < z -> A (Z.succ n) -> A n) -> forall n : Z, n <= z -> (forall m : Z, m <= z -> Z.succ n <= m -> A m) -> A n
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.left_induction : forall A : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : Z, A z -> (forall n : Z, n < z -> A (Z.succ n) -> A n) -> forall n : Z, n <= z -> A n
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qminus = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qplus x (QArith_base.Qopp y) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q Arguments QArith_base.Qminus (_ _)%Q_scope
